title: Change data capture transition
summary: Use CDC to synchronize data changes during phased migration without tight coupling.

decisionGuidance.problemSolved: Legacy systems and new services must share data during transition; direct coupling creates brittleness.
whenToUse: You are decomposing a shared database
whenNotToUse: You can cut over data ownership quickly with minimal overlap

gotchas: Event contracts drift from true semantics
thingsToWatchOutFor.opinionatedGuidance: Treat CDC events as transitional; move to domain events owned by the new domain over time.

complexity.rationale: Data correctness and ownership are difficult.

realWorldExample.approach: Published CDC to keep read models current during transition.
realWorldExample.outcome: Enabled phased cutover without freezing delivery.
